text: Mehrdad Minavand (, 30 November 1975 â€“ 27 January 2021) was an Iranian professional footballer and coach. He played mostly as a left midfielder, but he also was a left winger or left-back. He played for the Iran national football team and was a participant at the 1998 FIFA World Cup. On 21 January 2021, Minavand was hospitalised in Tehran with COVID-19. Six days later, he died from the virus on 27 January, aged 45. ==References== Category:1975 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Iranian footballers Category:Iranian football managers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Tehran Category:Sportspeople from Tehran
title: Mehrdad Minavand
